body.p: The core of oXygen XML Author can be deployed on a server, allowing a variety of HTML5 enabled client devices to edit and review XML content. Despite the efforts spent to ensure that the frameworks, options and plugins behave similarly in both WebApp and standalone version of oXygen XML, there might be some differences imposed by specific platform limitations.

was designed to accommodate a large degree of customization on several layers:

section.title: Options
section.p: Functionality common with the standalone distribution of oXygen XML share the same options. This allows you to configure a consistent editing experience for all users.

section.title: Documentation frameworks
section.p: Custom documentation frameworks can be re-used between the oXygen standalone distribution and . comes bundled with especially tuned frameworks for DITA, DocBook, TEI and XHTML. Any other framework from the standalone distribution can also be customized and used in .

section.title: Server side
section.p:
's server side can be customized by using the following plugin types:
The URLStreamHandler plugins can be used to integrate the WebApp with CMS-es or XML databases.
The WorkspaceAccess plugins which provides access to the oXygen plugin-level Java API.

section.title: Client side
section.p: Client side customization is available through a JavaScript API. Unlike the server side customization, it can be used to modify the application's GUI.
